title.rendered: ICC reprimands Aaron Finch for use of ‘audible obscenity’

content.rendered:
Australia captain Aaron Finch has recited an official reprimand for use of audible obscenity to the umpire during the first T20 against England in Perth on Sunday. According to officials, he breached level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct. The 35-year-old was caught by stump mic abusing umpire during the confusion over DRS in the ninth over of England’s innings. One demerit point has been added to Finch’s disciplinary record.

Read also:India stars make big moves in latest T20I Rankings
